verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of the Preacher <WH6953>, the son <WH1121> of David <WH1732>, king <WH4428> in Jerusalem <WH3389>.
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities <WH1892>, saith <WH559> the Preacher <WH6953>; vanity <WH1892> of vanities <WH1892>, all is vanity <WH1892>.
What profit <WH3504> hath man <WH120> of all his labor <WH5999> wherein he laboreth <WH5998> under the sun <WH8121>?
One generation <WH1755> goeth <WH1980>, and another generation <WH1755> cometh <WH935>; but the earth <WH776> abideth <WH5975> for ever <WH5769>.
The sun <WH8121> also ariseth <WH2224>, and the sun <WH8121> goeth down <WH935>, and hasteth <WH7602> to its place <WH4725> where it ariseth <WH2224>.

The wind <WH7307> goeth <WH1980> toward the south <WH1864>, and turneth about <WH5437> unto the north <WH6828>; it turneth about continually <WH1980> in its course <WH7307>, and the wind returneth again <WH7725> to its circuits <WH5439>.

All the rivers <WH5158> run <WH1980> into the sea <WH3220>, yet the sea <WH3220> is not full <WH4392>; unto the place <WH4725> whither the rivers <WH5158> go <WH1980>, thither they go <WH1980> again <WH3212>.

All things <WH1697> are full of weariness <WH3023>; man <WH376> cannot <WH3201> utter <WH1696> it <WH5869>: the eye is not satisfied <WH7646> with seeing <WH7200>, nor the ear <WH241> filled <WH4390> with hearing <WH8085>.
That which hath been is that which shall be <WH6213>; and that which hath been done is that which shall be done <WH6213>: and there is no new <WH2319> thing under the sun <WH8121>.
Is there <WH3426> a thing <WH1697> whereof it may be said <WH559>, See <WH7200>, this is new <WH2319>? it hath been long ago <WH3528>, in the ages <WH5769> which were before us <WH6440>.

There is no remembrance <WH2146> of the former <WH7223> generations <WH2146>; neither shall there be any remembrance of the latter generations that are to come <WH314>, among those that shall come after <WH314>.
I the Preacher <WH6953> was king <WH4428> over Israel <WH3478> in Jerusalem <WH3389>.

And I applied <WH5414> my heart <WH3820> to seek <WH1875> and to search out <WH8446> by wisdom <WH2451> concerning all that is done <WH6213> under heaven <WH8064>: it is a sore <WH7451> travail <WH6045> that God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> to the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> to be exercised therewith <WH6031>.
I have seen <WH7200> all the works <WH4639> that are done <WH6213> under the sun <WH8121>; and <WH1892>, behold, all is vanity and a striving <WH7469> after wind <WH7307>.
That which is crooked <WH5791> cannot <WH3201> be made straight <WH8626>; and that which is wanting <WH2642> cannot <WH3201> be numbered <WH4487>.

I communed <WH1696> with mine own heart <WH3820>, saying <WH559>, Lo <WH3254>, I have gotten me great <WH1431> wisdom <WH2451> above all that were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem <WH3389>; yea <WH3820>, my heart hath had great <WH7235> experience <WH7200> of wisdom <WH2451> and knowledge <WH1847>.

And I applied <WH5414> my heart <WH3820> to know <WH3045> wisdom <WH2451>, and to know <WH3045> madness <WH1947> and folly <WH5531>: I perceived <WH3045> that this <WH1571> also was a striving <WH7475> after wind <WH7307>.
For in much <WH7230> wisdom <WH2451> is much <WH7230> grief <WH3708>; and he that increaseth <WH3254> knowledge <WH1847> increaseth <WH3254> sorrow <WH4341>.
